text: Windsor is normally great for this, long wide finish straight so you often get two groups and no one know what’s going on

text: As an aside, Windsor is a great course to go racing. Get the boat up or pay for parking up near the front door. Lovely little course, friendly regulars and staff, crazy loop-back course, decent phone reception(!), even a "pub" on the course, sort of...

elements.text: As an aside, Windsor is a great course to go racing. Get the boat up or pay for parking up near the front door. Lovely little course, friendly regulars and staff, crazy loop-back course, decent phone reception(!), even a "pub" on the course, sort of...

text: I'm hoping my children can become semi-pro gamblers, but I don't want them to believe that making some sort of judgement call at a race track makes any sort of difference to their edge.

text:
A short guide to racecourses near London:

Kempton: dump, but our dump, and better than a housing estate, especially on Boxing Day

Sandown: dated but y’know, Esher and all that. Feels like it was designed by the same guy who put the South Bank together somehow…

Ascot: cocaine fuelled muppets in a huge beast of a building, and its up a knee-killer of a hill from the station

Windsor: lovely. Really. Take the missus, she’ll love it.

Lingfield: more laptops in the stands than in the local PC World the one time I went

elements.text: A short guide to racecourses near London:

Windsor: lovely. Really. Take the missus, she’ll love it.
